page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area is situated in the north of Gloucestershire close to the north- facing Cotswold edge.Crossing the area from S.W.to N.E.is the valley of the Cam, a small stream. The ground rises to 214 m at the N.W. margin then falls rapidly to 95 m through Weston Park.South of the valley the land rises gently to 246 m as it rises to the high Cotswolds. Within the valley,surrounded by hills,lies Chipping Campden with Broad Campden a kilometre to the S.E. Most of the 2000 (approx) inhabitants of the area live here. The area is farmland with expanses of deciduous woodland and copses. Hedges and dry stonewalls outline the fields which still present a colourful patchwork of crops in the summer. The roads serve the area well and allow easy access to the large towns round about.
